metadata.Title: CVE-2019-7524 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In Dovecot before 2.2.36.3 and 2.3.x before 2.3.5.1, a local attacker can cause a buffer overflow in the indexer-worker process, which can be used to elevate to root. This occurs because of missing checks in the fts and pop3-uidl components.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-7524` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

dovecot-core - 1:2.2.33.2-1ubuntu4.3
dovecot-gssapi - 1:2.2.33.2-1ubuntu4.3
dovecot-imapd - 1:2.2.33.2-1ubuntu4.3
dovecot-ldap - 1:2.2.33.2-1ubuntu4.3
dovecot-lmtpd - 1:2.2.33.2-1ubuntu4.3
dovecot-managesieved - 1:2.2.33.2-1ubuntu4.3
dovecot-mysql - 1:2.2.33.2-1ubuntu4.3
dovecot-pgsql - 1:2.2.33.2-1ubuntu4.3
dovecot-pop3d - 1:2.2.33.2-1ubuntu4.3
dovecot-sieve - 1:2.2.33.2-1ubuntu4.3
dovecot-solr - 1:2.2.33.2-1ubuntu4.3
dovecot-sqlite - 1:2.2.33.2-1ubuntu4.3
mail-stack-delivery - 1:2.2.33.2-1ubuntu4.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: dovecot package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.2.33.2-1ubuntu4.3').
